individual_metadata.synopsis: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."

AD_ToStorage.synopsis: Nettie has arrived with the 'infected' player and is  gesturing for them go into the storage unit.

WoundedBird.synopsis: Wounded bird is resting on the table after being treated by Nettie. It's probably going to die. If you poke it repeatedly, it will die.
WoundedBird.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. start the game 2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Resolve the Plea at the Gate situation (oe denraiddone)4. goto -440.89, 1.46, -6.985. CTRL-K Nettie.6. Talk to the bird.

AD_Studying.synopsis: After poisoning the tadpoled player, Nettie settles down at her old Master's desk to see if she can uncover any secrets about the tadpole in his research.

LockedUp.synopsis: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

PAD_Dying.synopsis: The player has the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN on them. This status has 3 stages leading to death. This PAD plays after a long rest: the player let the status get worse and worse. Right after this PAD, the player dies. These are their last words.

TadpoledScene.synopsis: This occurs after the player has agreed to helpNettie. She is escorting the player through the grove to Halsin's Chamber. She knows we're dangerous and wants to get us into the lab quickly.

AD_TadpoledCombat.synopsis: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene

AD_Busy.synopsis: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.

PAD_Cyanide.synopsis: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.

Stayed.synopsis: After the scene where she scratches you. Player persuaded Nettie and accepted to take her poison. She told them their only hope is Halsin. Nettie is back in her room, she's working.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.synopsis: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).

Bird.synopsis: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.

PAD_LockedUp.synopsis: This is the VB that plays after Nettie locks the players up in her study once the players refuse to take the poison. She doesn't fight them, but the party reflects on her actions as a result of confessing the existence of the tadpoles.Speaker 1 is the player who disclosed the information and may show regret or indifference towards the current state.Speaker 2 comments on speaker 1 telling the truth to Nettie.

CombatStarts.synopsis: The player is locked in Nettie's lab and has cured themselves before persuading her. Normally, script starts the dialog 'DEN_Apprentice_LockedUp' to react to this, but it can fail if the player is wild shaped for example. This node taken from the dialog 'DEN_CGB_Apprentice' gives the feedback thatNettie is going hostile.
CombatStarts.how_to_trigger: 1. Venture forth as a Druid Human Male2. In recon "loadlevel WDL_Main_A"3. In recon "goto -437.00, 1.46, -6.00"4. CTRL +SHIFT+ L on Avatar to level up5. In recon "roll 20"6. Pickpocket the "Elixir of Silvanus" from Nettie to be used to cure the poison later7. Speak with Nettie and explain the Tadpole.8. Follow Nettie in other room, dialog starts(If Nettie triggers crime dialog, persuade her otherwise and full rest camp inside to restart Nettie's pathing)9. Select dialog #4 “Is everyone being captured…”10. Select dialog #3 “Just hurry up and cure me…”11. Select dialog #3 “No, nothing strange…”12. Select dialog "Nothing, I'm sure."13. Select dialog #1 “Hold out your arm”14. Select dialog #3 “Grab the branch from her…”15. Select dialog #4 "Turn and leave"16. Wildshape into a Wolf or any form17. Drink the  Elixir of Silvanus18. Observe dialog will be triggered with an in-game view

AD_TadpoledStart.synopsis: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.

AD_WithBird.synopsis: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.

PAD_FeelingSick.synopsis: |The player has the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN on them. This status has 3 stages leading to death. The player is slowly dying.The first stage is right after being stung by Nettie in the situation Halsin's Apprentice (the reaction of the player is covered in the dialog DEN_Apprentice_Cyanide).This PAD plays after a long rest: the player rested but the status is worsening. The status is getting to stage 2 and then to stage 3, each time having worse gameplay effects.After stage 3, the status kills the player; the PAD DEN_Apprentice_PAD_Dying plays in that case.|

PAD_Relieved.synopsis: The player is cured from poison ( the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN). This status has 3 stages leading to death. Each time the player make a long rest, they get closer to death.This PAD of relief plays only if the status reached the stages 2 or 3. The status was getting worse and worse, which must have been worrying, but now they've been cured.

HealedBird.synopsis: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.

AD.synopsis: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.

Cyanide.synopsis: Nettie leads the player into a lab and fetches a thorn. The player doesn't know, but the thorn is a deadly poison. Nettie knows it's the only choice she has - the player could transform into a monster and kill everyone in the camp. She sees this as a kindness - the transformation is terrible - so she has a very 'matter of fact nurse' tone about the whole thing before she scratches you, but will get stressed if you resist. Once she's scratched the player, her tone will be softer - kinder. She plans to sit with you while you pass and make it as easy as possible. The player will have to convince her they're not a threat if they're going to get the antidote. She'll be slow to convince, hesitant to allow any risk to the camp. Nettie is STANDING for this entire dialog.

PAD_SeeDrow.synopsis: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.

reasoning: Nettie is the one who takes the player to the storage unit where they can be quarantined due to the tadpole infection, which means that 'AD_ToStorage' must follow 'TadpoledScene'.
'TadpoledScene' must come before 'AD_TadpoledCombat' because combat triggered during the tadpoled scene is a direct consequence of agreeing to help Nettie.
'PAD_Dying' occurs only after the player has let the status from 'DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN' get worse, implying it follows after the player has the status for a while.

'PAD_Cyanide' and 'Cyanide' are mutually exclusive with 'LockedUp' since the player cannot take the poison if they are locked up. Thus, if the player is locked up, they cannot have the cyanide interaction.
'LockedUp' occurs during the interaction where Nettie is at the table studying Halsin's notes, which is a separate sequence from the cyanide interaction.
'PAD_Relieved' follows 'PAD_Dying' since it represents a recovery from the death state caused by 'PAD_Dying'.
'HealedBird' occurs after 'WoundedBird' because it represents the bird's recovery after some time has passed.

5.speaker: Nettie

55.speaker: Player

45.speaker: Nettie

45.context: NodeContext: In command, but grave. She's decided she has to kill the player.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Actually, never mind. I'll get help elsewhere.

16.speaker: Nettie
16.context: NodeContext: Urgent 'No!' you can't just let them walk out of here. It's a dangerous situation.

95.speaker: Player

10.speaker: Nettie

10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking closely at the player's eyesNodeContext: Looking closely at the player's eyes. Starts jovial, then realises something horrible

87.speaker: Nettie
87.text: Did it look like a tadpole? But from your worst nightmare? All slime, teeth, and tentacles?
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Steps back, NodeContext: Steps back. You realise the player might be very dangerous, but don't want to spook them.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Right. Yes, I'm... very tired indeed.

35.speaker: Nettie
35.text: Then get some rest. There's no better magic.

64.speaker: Nettie
64.text: Take a nip of whiskey before bed if you need to. Come back to me if that doesn't do it.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Do you know anything about mind flayers?

59.speaker: Nettie
59.context: NodeContext: Cautious. You've just asked what she knows about very dangerous creatures.

74.speaker: Nettie

74.context: NodeContext: Suspects you're not telling her everything

19.speaker: Nettie

44.speaker: Nettie

0.speaker: Player
0.text: No, of course not. I ask everyone that question.

20.speaker: Nettie
20.text: All right. Well, come back if you need anything.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I hear Halsin's the best healer around. I need to find him.

15.speaker: Nettie
15.text: You and every other soul here.

14.speaker: Nettie

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'll take whatever I can get. Heal me.

12.speaker: Player

39.speaker: Nettie
39.text: Suit yourself. I'll be here if you change your mind.

88.speaker: Nettie

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Healing. Looks like I came to the right person.

58.speaker: Nettie

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Are you good enough to treat people, or just pets?

7.speaker: Nettie

85.speaker: Nettie

34.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like people of your species, but she's willing to give you a chance.

67.speaker: Nettie

72.speaker: Nettie

71.speaker: Nettie

86.speaker: Nettie

AD_Studying_1.speaker: Nettie

LockedUp_18.speaker: Player

LockedUp_2.speaker: Nettie

LockedUp_67.text: Now, I've an antidote - um... where is the bloody thing?

LockedUp_39.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_39.text: Well, not to worry. Have a read of that book - Flora of the Dalelands. There's a recipe for your antidote in there. It won't do anything for what's in your skull, though.

LockedUp_4.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_4.text: I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.
LockedUp_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

LockedUp_41.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_41.text: Master Halsin and I were tracking them, studying them, trying to figure out what the hells was going on.

LockedUp_20.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_20.text: Because you should all be changing - there should be a small army of mind flayers out there! But you're not. Weird powers aside, you seem perfectly normal.

LockedUp_89.speaker: Player
LockedUp_89.text: What do you mean 'should' be changing?

LockedUp_136.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_136.text: Mind flayers reproduce by infecting someone with their parasite. Seven gruesome days later, the victim transforms and a new mind flayer is born.

LockedUp_115.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_115.text: The thing in your skull, though? It's different to anything in our records.

LockedUp_49.speaker: Player
LockedUp_49.text: You must've learned something from studying them.

LockedUp_26.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_26.text: For one, that thing in your head is like nothing we've ever seen from mind flayers.

LockedUp_46.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_46.text: It's one of their worms, for sure, but this one gives you powers - telepathic connections. And it doesn't turn you into one of them.

LockedUp_28.speaker: Player
LockedUp_28.text: So you think it's only a matter of time?

LockedUp_8.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_8.text: Could be, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

LockedUp_129.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_129.text: When Master Halsin heard the adventurers were heading that way, he saw a chance to get answers. Joined on the spot.

LockedUp_130.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_130.text: Whatever he found there, he didn't make it back.

LockedUp_91.speaker: Player
LockedUp_91.text: What do you want me to do?

LockedUp_90.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_90.text: The thing is, I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. None of us can even get close.

LockedUp_72.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_72.text: I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. And if my birds can't get close, what chance do I have?

LockedUp_12.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_12.text: I think so. I hope so. I've sent birds to find him, but they can't get close without goblins trying to shoot them down.

LockedUp_104.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_104.text: You, though? You're one of them - technically speaking, I mean. They might not kill someone carrying their parasite.

LockedUp_120.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_120.text: If you can find Halsin and get him out of there, we can discover what he learned. And perhaps he can save your life. How's that sound?

LockedUp_79.speaker: Player
LockedUp_79.text: I already know where to find him: the worg pens of the goblin camp.

LockedUp_60.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_60.text: Gods above - why didn't you say so?
LockedUp_60.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

LockedUp_100.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_100.text: Please, you have to bring him back to us. For your own sake as much as ours.

LockedUp_65.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_65.text: Thank you. It would mean everything to the grove. To me.

LockedUp_57.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_57.text: I wish I could tell you what happened out there, but those adventurers were the only witnesses. And they're long gone.

LockedUp_47.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_47.text: All I can say for sure is they all went to the old temple of Selûne and Master Halsin didn't make it back.

LockedUp_94.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_94.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the oath you swore.

LockedUp_13.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_13.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the vial. Remember your oath.

LockedUp_108.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_108.text: I wish I could tell you more, but only those adventurers know what happened out there.

LockedUp_15.speaker: Player
LockedUp_15.text: It sounds like you're making a lot of assumptions that could kill me.

LockedUp_24.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_24.text: The way I see it, you have two options: Halsin or that wyvern poison.

LockedUp_42.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_42.text: I don't envy your choice, truly. But this is the hand fate's dealt you.

LockedUp_116.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_116.text: The way I see it, you have two options: Halsin or death - whatever form it takes.

LockedUp_35.speaker: Player
LockedUp_35.text: You're sure he can cure me?

LockedUp_96.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_96.text: I can't make any promises. This is like nothing we've seen before.

LockedUp_44.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_44.text: But I know this for sure: Master Halsin is the only one close to understanding these things. He's your best bet to survive.

LockedUp_101.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_101.text: Otherwise, that vial's your only option.

LockedUp_40.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_40.text: Otherwise you'll need to end things yourself, before the transformation really takes hold.

LockedUp_106.speaker: Player
LockedUp_106.text: That sounds like suicide. I won't do it.

LockedUp_48.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_48.text: It might be suicide either way. Trust me, you do not want to become one of those monsters.

LockedUp_140.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_140.text: But of course, the choice is yours. I just hope you find a cure out there.

LockedUp_121.speaker: Player
LockedUp_121.text: You said you were tracking other victims. Did they change?

LockedUp_99.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_99.text: Hard to say, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

LockedUp_139.speaker: Player
LockedUp_139.text: Excellent news! All the power, none of the tentacles.

LockedUp_123.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_123.text: I wouldn't be so sure. There's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

LockedUp_19.speaker: Player
LockedUp_19.text: Just tell me if there's a cure or not.

LockedUp_38.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_38.text: You can't cure what you don't understand. And as much as I know about mind flayers, I can't make heads nor tails of this.

LockedUp_135.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_135.text: I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.
LockedUp_135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

LockedUp_59.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_59.text: Thank you. I truly hope it doesn't come to that.

LockedUp_50.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_50.text: Here, take this. It'll stop the poison, but I can't do anything for that wriggler in your head.
LockedUp_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidoteNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidote

LockedUp_119.speaker: Player
LockedUp_119.text: Fine, just give it to me.

LockedUp_64.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_64.text: Yes? Is there anything I can do?

LockedUp_128.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_128.context: NodeContext: A little sadly. She wants to save you, but feels that she morally can't.

LockedUp_62.speaker: Player
LockedUp_62.text: I know where Halsin is! Give me the antidote or he'll die too!

LockedUp_145.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_145.text: Hells' teeth. All right. I'll tell you where the antidote is, but there's a condition.
LockedUp_145.context: NodeContext: Realises that if she acts quickly, she can save her mentor.

LockedUp_133.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_133.text: This is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.

LockedUp_105.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_105.text: Swear to me that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.
LockedUp_105.context: NodeContext: 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

LockedUp_122.speaker: Player
LockedUp_122.text: We can both see I have no symptoms - I'm not about to change!

LockedUp_102.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_102.text: Same as the drow... But Master Halsin said he'd turn eventually.

LockedUp_54.speaker: Player
LockedUp_54.text: Eventually? That gives me time to find a cure.

LockedUp_16.speaker: Player
LockedUp_16.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

LockedUp_9.speaker: Player
LockedUp_9.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

LockedUp_7.speaker: Player
LockedUp_7.text: The grove is in terrible danger - cure me and I'll tell your leader how to save it.

LockedUp_6.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_6.text: All right! Master Halsin thought the tadpole was dormant, so you have some time. Perhaps it's only fair I let you use it.

LockedUp_88.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_88.text: But first - this is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.
LockedUp_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds out vial of poisonNodeContext: Firm tone. Holds out vial of poison

LockedUp_85.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_85.text: But first - swear to me that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.
LockedUp_85.context: NodeContext: Firm tone. 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

LockedUp_134.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_134.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

LockedUp_43.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_43.text: The door's locked. Neither of us are leaving until this is done.

LockedUp_103.speaker: Player
LockedUp_103.text: It's been days. If I were going to turn, it would've happened by now.

LockedUp_117.speaker: Player
LockedUp_117.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

LockedUp_137.speaker: Player
LockedUp_137.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

LockedUp_45.speaker: Player
LockedUp_45.text: Recite her order's druidic law - this can't be allowed!

LockedUp_124.speaker: Player
LockedUp_124.text: You can't do this - your leader needs to talk to me.

LockedUp_138.speaker: Player
LockedUp_138.text: You can't do this - I'm on a secret mission. Everything depends on it.

LockedUp_110.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_110.text: It doesn't matter if you're Silvanus himself come to walk among us - infected is infected.
LockedUp_110.context: NodeContext: Sill-van-us, the god Nettie worships

LockedUp_34.speaker: Player
LockedUp_34.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!

LockedUp_126.speaker: Player
LockedUp_126.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!

LockedUp_31.speaker: Player
LockedUp_31.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - no druid could support this!

LockedUp_55.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_55.text: I know you're angry, but how many people would die if you changed? I can't take that risk.

LockedUp_76.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_76.text: There's no stopping you, is there?

LockedUp_81.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_81.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

LockedUp_87.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_87.text: I hope your friend sees sense soon. She doesn't have much time left.
LockedUp_87.context: NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

LockedUp_22.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_22.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know she'll take the wyvern poison if she starts to change.
LockedUp_22.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

LockedUp_131.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_131.text: I want to help, but I can't. Not until I know she'll do what has to be done, if it comes to that.
LockedUp_131.context: NodeContext: caught in a tough place

LockedUp_92.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_92.text: And? Will you swear you'll take the poison?
LockedUp_92.context: InternalNodeContext: She has the wyvern poison in her inventory

LockedUp_97.speaker: Player
LockedUp_97.text: Have you lost your mind? No!

LockedUp_127.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_127.text: I don't want to hurt you, but I can't let you live. You're too dangerous.
LockedUp_127.context: NodeContext: Player's cured themselves and may escape from the room you've locked them in

LockedUp_25.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_25.context: NodeContext: You're about to attack the player with a poisoned thorn

LockedUp_17.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_17.text: Then we've nothing more to talk about.
LockedUp_17.context: NodeContext: Player refuses to take your poison, you refuse to let them out.

LockedUp_112.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_112.text: If it helps, they won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give them.

LockedUp_113.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_113.text: You're alive? There's no way I'm stopping you, is there?
LockedUp_113.context: NodeContext: Surprised "you're alive?"  but then sadly resigned. She didn't want to let you go.

LockedUp_118.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp_118.text: If it helps, he won't feel any pain. It's the best death I can give him.
LockedUp_118.context: NodeContext: Talking to non-infected player about infected player

PAD_Dying_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Dying_0.text: Argh, the poison. It's too much. It's too late...
PAD_Dying_0.context: NodeContext: You're dying, poison has overtaken your system. These are your last words.

TadpoledScene_2.speaker: Nettie
TadpoledScene_2.text: Let's go, the workshop's this way.
TadpoledScene_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Walking towards the workshopNodeContext: There is a weight to her voice - it's clearly serious (she's planning on giving the player posion, to take should the transform into a monster)

TadpoledScene_5.speaker: Player
TadpoledScene_5.text: I don't have time for this.

TadpoledScene_1.speaker: Nettie
TadpoledScene_1.text: You don't have time for anything else. That tadpole will kill you.

TadpoledScene_4.speaker: Nettie
TadpoledScene_4.context: NodeContext: Guiding PC into the lab

AD_TadpoledCombat_0.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat_0.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

AD_TadpoledCombat_1.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat_1.text: Please. Don't make me do this.

AD_TadpoledCombat_3.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat_3.text: This is for your own good, why can't you see that?

AD_Busy_0.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

PAD_Cyanide_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide_1.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide_3.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide_3.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide_0.text: Better to have on hand than not.

PAD_Cyanide_5.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide_5.text: Wouldn't take the stuff no matter what. If I'm gonna go, let it be in a blaze of glory.

PAD_Cyanide_4.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide_4.text: Hopefully we'll be rid of this parasite before we even need to think in that direction.

Stayed_2.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_2.text: Your companion's a brave one. Not everyone would make a promise like that.
Stayed_2.context: InternalNodeContext: This player obviously is not the one who took the poison since they have not met Nettie!

Stayed_17.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_17.text: Please keep an eye on him while you're looking for Master Halsin... just in case.

Stayed_27.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_27.text: Please keep an eye on them while you're looking for Master Halsin... just in case.

Stayed_0.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_0.text: Please keep an eye on her while you're looking for Master Halsin... just in case.

Stayed_14.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_14.text: I - Thank you. For trying, and for telling me. At least now we know.

Stayed_32.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_32.text: Excuse me. I think I need to be alone.

Stayed_25.speaker: Player
Stayed_25.text: Halsin's alive - he's being held at the goblins' camp.

Stayed_20.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_20.text: Thank the Father he's alive. Please, you have to get him out of there.

Stayed_1.speaker: Player
Stayed_1.text: That's the plan. I'll do whatever it takes.

Stayed_30.speaker: Player
Stayed_30.text: I'm not risking my neck against that many goblins.

Stayed_7.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_7.text: Then your friend's dead. No one else will free them from that tadpole.

Stayed_10.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_10.text: Please, be smart about this. Save him.

Stayed_18.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_18.text: Then you'll both die. No one else will free you from that tadpole.

Stayed_24.speaker: Player
Stayed_24.text: Do you know where Halsin went?

Stayed_15.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_15.text: He and the adventurers were headed to the ruined temple in the west.

Stayed_9.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_9.text: Master Halsin studied that drow for days, and he was sure something at the temple could help his research. I'm praying he was right.

Stayed_5.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_5.text: Please be careful - for both your sake and Master Halsin's.

Stayed_11.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_11.text: Please hurry - for both your sakes.

Stayed_22.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_22.text: I hear you brought Kagha back from the brink. My thanks.

Stayed_8.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_8.text: But what about your other mission? Any word on Master Halsin?

Stayed_23.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_23.text: To lose such a great man. It just doesn't feel real.

Stayed_28.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_28.text: It was brave of your companion to agree to take the poison.
Stayed_28.context: InternalNodeContext: This player obviously is not the one who took the poison since they have not met Nettie!

Stayed_33.speaker: Nettie
Stayed_33.text: I hear you put an end to Kagha's treachery. My thanks.

PAD_TadpoleResearch_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_0.text: This 'Halsin' has been studying the tadpole.

PAD_TadpoleResearch_5.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_5.text: We should find him, maybe he can help?

PAD_TadpoleResearch_1.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_1.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch_3.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_3.text: We gain nothing by chasing strangers. Only a githyanki crèche holds our cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch_2.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_2.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch_6.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_6.text: Forget Halsin. Only a githyanki crèche holds our cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch_4.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_4.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch_7.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch_7.text: All the more reason to hurry.

Bird_17.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird_17.text: To find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

Bird_13.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird_13.text: I have to find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

Bird_3.speaker: Player
Bird_3.text: I need information, friend. Spare me a moment?

Bird_16.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird_16.text: For one of our own. But be quick.

Bird_10.speaker: Player
Bird_10.text: What's waiting for us outside this grove? In the wilds?

Bird_4.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird_4.text: Goblins. Gnolls. Even a couple of your underground cousins.

Bird_8.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird_8.text: Now I have to go. There's not a moment to lose!

Bird_15.speaker: Narrator
Bird_15.text: *He flutters into the air without another word, setting off at a determined pace.*

Bird_5.speaker: Player
Bird_5.text: Do you know Baldur's Gate? Is the city far?

Bird_12.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird_12.text: I know these hills, and there's no city here.
Bird_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bird looks at you curiously

Bird_7.speaker: Player
Bird_7.text: I'm looking for the druid Halsin. Where is he?

Bird_14.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird_14.text: That's what I'm trying to find out!

PAD_LockedUp_1.speaker: Player
PAD_LockedUp_1.text: So much for honesty. Our healer turned into a jailor pretty quickly once she heard about the tadpole.

PAD_LockedUp_0.speaker: Player
PAD_LockedUp_0.text: Can't blame anyone for reacting with fear - but it might do to keep our condition on a need-to-know basis.

CombatStarts_0.speaker: Nettie
CombatStarts_0.text: I tried to make this easy on you and give you some time. But if you won't stop, I'll have to stop you.

AD_TadpoledStart_0.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart_0.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

AD_WithBird_1.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird_1.text: They did a number on you, didn't they?
AD_WithBird_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Sadly

AD_WithBird_5.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Gently, as if to a child

AD_WithBird_4.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird_4.text: It's messy, but we'll fix you up.

PAD_FeelingSick_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick_0.text: I don't feel too good. What did that druid scratch me with?
PAD_FeelingSick_0.context: NodeContext: Poison is slowly taking effect. You don't feel great, but it's nothing serious yet.

PAD_FeelingSick_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick_1.text: The druid's poison is spreading. I need a cure, fast.
PAD_FeelingSick_1.context: NodeContext: Poison is gripping your system. You're probably in pain.

PAD_Relieved_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Relieved_0.text: I can feel the poison clearing - I'm cured!

HealedBird_0.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird_0.text: There was so much noise out there. I'm glad you're okay.

HealedBird_1.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The other blue jay have the exact same line

HealedBird_2.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird_2.text: Wing's still a little stiff, but I'm getting stronger!

AD_0.speaker: Nettie
AD_0.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

AD_1.speaker: Nettie
AD_1.text: Still have some mugrot in the stores, but no blueleaf sap.
AD_1.context: NodeContext: Distracted, checking through her inventory at her desk

AD_2.speaker: Nettie
AD_2.text: What if Halsin is - no. Don't go there.
AD_2.context: NodeContext: An image of your master, hurt and alone, has flashed in your mind. You're terrified for him and struggling to focus on the task at hand.

AD_3.speaker: Nettie
AD_3.text: By Silvanus, I just want my bed.
AD_3.context: NodeContext: Anxious and exhausted, you're stressed and struggling to cope. [pr: sil-van-us]

AD_4.speaker: Nettie
AD_4.text: Take it one step at a time, Nettie. Come on.
AD_4.context: NodeContext: You're trying to calm yourself down - you're overwhelmed and fighting not to show it

AD_5.speaker: Nettie
AD_5.text: I'll need more yew leaves before this is over.
AD_5.context: NodeContext: Distracted, checking through her inventory at her desk

AD_6.speaker: Nettie
AD_6.text: I'll have to tidy this place.

AD_7.speaker: Nettie
AD_7.text: Think - what else do we need?

AD_8.speaker: Nettie
AD_8.text: Silvanus save us if the goblins get in here.

AD_9.speaker: Nettie
AD_9.text: The grove's going to feel so empty now.

AD_10.speaker: Nettie
AD_10.text: We're low on everything that I need to staunch a wound.
AD_10.context: NodeContext: Distracted, checking through her inventory at her desk

Cyanide_13.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_13.text: Don't worry about him on the table. I'm not in the habit of killing drow.
Cyanide_13.context: NodeContext: gesturing to dead drow on the table

Cyanide_278.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_278.text: He attacked Master Halsin and I in the woods, leading a pack of goblins.

Cyanide_295.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_295.text: Tadpole crawled out of his head soon after.

Cyanide_282.speaker: Player
Cyanide_282.text: The drow and I have the same kind of parasite?

Cyanide_417.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_417.text: Seems so. Gave Master Halsin a right start.

Cyanide_315.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Nettie turns to the desk, examining it until she finds what sh'es lookign for a long thron that's been removed from a vine.

Cyanide_312.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_312.text: It's why he joined the adventurers on their expedition. To find out what was happening.
Cyanide_312.context: NodeContext: JLatino: Holding up a long thorn that's been removed from a vine, nettie almost murmurs the line, distracted by her own thoughts

Cyanide_284.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_284.text: A pity you got me instead of him. He understands these things - studied them. Still, we have options.
Cyanide_284.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie moves between player and exitNodeContext: Previous line was murmured to yourself, the next line is very 'okay, let's get down to business.' This line should be a transition between the two.

Cyanide_347.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_347.text: You don't have to be here for this.
Cyanide_347.context: NodeContext: Nettie addresses the others in the party here

Cyanide_166.speaker: Lae'zel
Cyanide_166.text: I will remain. I've a vested interest in the outcome.

Cyanide_292.speaker: Shadowheart
Cyanide_292.text: No, I'll stay. I'd rather know exactly what you're up to.

Cyanide_126.speaker: Karlach
Cyanide_126.text: I'd like to keep an eye on things, thanks.

Cyanide_71.speaker: Astarion
Cyanide_71.text: Please, don't mind me. I'll just watch.

Cyanide_348.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_348.text: All right, let's see what we can do.

Cyanide_328.speaker: Player
Cyanide_328.text: Halsin? I saw him in the goblin camp.

Cyanide_233.speaker: Player
Cyanide_233.text: Thank you, I'll take anything that can help.

Cyanide_38.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_38.text: Of course. Now, tell me what's been happening. Any symptoms? Strange events?

Cyanide_211.speaker: Player
Cyanide_211.text: What's that plant? Will it help?

Cyanide_311.speaker: Player
Cyanide_311.text: It 'might'? What aren't you telling me?

Cyanide_118.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_118.text: I'm telling you everything you need to know. Believe me on that.

Cyanide_35.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_35.text: I want to help you, but I can't unless you work with me. So: has anything unusual happened to you?

Cyanide_244.speaker: Player
Cyanide_244.text: I can merge my mind with anyone else that's infected.

Cyanide_96.speaker: Player
Cyanide_96.text: I fell from a ship in the sky, but something caught me. It saved my life.

Cyanide_171.speaker: Player
Cyanide_171.text: An intellect devourer spoke to me as if I were one of its own.

Cyanide_349.speaker: Player
Cyanide_349.text: No, nothing strange, I just want it out of my head.

Cyanide_9.speaker: Player
Cyanide_9.text: Well... if someone else has a tadpole, our minds can merge.

Cyanide_196.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_196.text: Victims can identify each other? Not that the others know they're victims, of course.

Cyanide_149.speaker: Player
Cyanide_149.text: I did fall from a ship in the sky, but something caught me.

Cyanide_16.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_16.text: Protected from on high? Sounds like the drow - Master Halsin said he was tougher than he had any right to be.

Cyanide_391.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_391.text: How'd you pick up the parasite? Halsin was desperate to find where all this was happening.

Cyanide_70.speaker: Player
Cyanide_70.text: You're asking a lot of questions...

Cyanide_60.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_60.text: Of course I am. Lives are on the line, and not just yours.

Cyanide_319.speaker: Player
Cyanide_319.text: Look, are you going to cure me or not?

Cyanide_48.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_48.text: I'm trying to help you, but I need to be sure.

Cyanide_21.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_21.text: So tell me, where'd you get that thing?

Cyanide_62.speaker: Player
Cyanide_62.text: On a mind flayer ship - I was kidnapped and infected.

Cyanide_202.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_202.text: A mind flayer ship? But Master Halsin was sure -

Cyanide_212.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_212.text: ...Look, you've been straight with me, so I'll be straight with you. You're dangerous. If you transform here, we're all dead.

Cyanide_382.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_382.text: But you seem like a good soul. You deserve a chance to save yourself.
Cyanide_382.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie puts away the poison thorn

Cyanide_53.speaker: Player
Cyanide_53.text: I don't know, I just woke up with it.

Cyanide_249.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_249.text: All right. I suppose that makes things easier.

Cyanide_411.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_411.context: NodeContext: JLatino: Nettie is more present now, conversational projection returns, she lowers the thron to her side and hold out her hand to take your arm

Cyanide_323.speaker: Player
Cyanide_323.text: So you can poison me? Absolutely not!

Cyanide_224.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_224.context: NodeContext: JLatino: Get me some alts for this one >> shifty, warm, emphatic

Cyanide_195.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_195.text: Now, your arm, please. You don't have time for games.
Cyanide_195.context: NodeContext: Holds out hand to take your arm

Cyanide_184.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_184.text: You came to me for help. Do you want it or not?
Cyanide_184.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: The player takes a step back

Cyanide_334.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_334.text: No! I can't let you leave - you could transform any second.
Cyanide_334.context: NodeContext: A little urgency in the voice

Cyanide_187.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_187.text: This is the last time I'll ask. Please.
Cyanide_187.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding out her hand to take your arm.NodeContext: Pain in her 'please'. She doesn't want to do this, but she has to. Holding out her hand to take your arm.

Cyanide_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: Nettie takes the player's arm and scratches them with the thorn.

Cyanide_206.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_206.context: NodeContext: JLatino: As through she's just given a child a booster shot, trying to releave the tention

Cyanide_350.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_350.text: Be careful. Your legs'll probably give out first.

Cyanide_55.speaker: Player
Cyanide_55.text: My legs? What kind of cure is this?

Cyanide_121.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_121.text: I'm sorry. Maybe Master Halsin could have plucked it from your head, but I can't.

Cyanide_380.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_380.text: Without him here, the only treatment for an illithid tadpole is death. You're a risk to the people around you.

Cyanide_67.speaker: Player
Cyanide_67.text: What in the hells have you done?

Cyanide_102.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_102.text: It's too late. It's already in your system.

Cyanide_37.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_37.text: I'm truly, truly sorry. For what it's worth, the poison is painless. It'll be like going to sleep.

Cyanide_155.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_155.text: Please, try to relax. This doesn't have to be hard.

Cyanide_337.speaker: Player
Cyanide_337.text: Examine the branch to identify the poison.

Cyanide_303.speaker: Player
Cyanide_303.text: Examine the branch - have you come across this plant before?

Cyanide_310.speaker: Player
Cyanide_310.text: Grab the branch and try to identify the poison.

Cyanide_49.speaker: Player
Cyanide_49.text: Grab and examine the branch - have you come across this plant before?

Cyanide_36.speaker: Narrator
Cyanide_36.text: *Not many thorns have such unique poison - it has to be Kelemvor's Kiss, a plant from the Dalelands. There is a cure but, try as you might, you can't recall it.*

Cyanide_406.speaker: Player
Cyanide_406.text: Give me the antidote. I know you have one.

Cyanide_403.speaker: Narrator
Cyanide_403.text: *You try to find a clue among the thorns, but there's nothing. You have no idea what poison's tainted your veins.*

Cyanide_353.speaker: Player
Cyanide_353.text: Whatever this is, you had better have an antidote.

Cyanide_416.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_416.text: You can't have it. I can't risk you turning - you'd kill us all.

Cyanide_420.speaker: Player
Cyanide_420.text: But I don't have symptoms - I'm not changing.

Cyanide_392.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_392.text: Same as the drow... But Master Halsin said he'd turn eventually.

Cyanide_154.speaker: Player
Cyanide_154.text: Eventually? That gives me time to find a cure.

Cyanide_290.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_290.text: Maybe, but it's one hell of a maybe. You could have days or seconds.

Cyanide_219.speaker: Player
Cyanide_219.text: I know where Halsin is! Give me the antidote or he'll die.

Cyanide_330.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_330.text: Hells' teeth, why didn't you say anything sooner? I'll tell you where the antidote is, but there's a condition.
Cyanide_330.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie puts away the poison thorn

Cyanide_239.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_239.text: This is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.

Cyanide_42.speaker: Player
Cyanide_42.text: As long as there's a chance, you're not saving me. You're committing murder.

Cyanide_259.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_259.text: Gods above. It's a risk, but maybe you deserve a chance...

Cyanide_39.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_39.text: All right! Master Halsin did say the drow's tadpole was dormant. Maybe yours is too.
Cyanide_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie Walks over to the desk againNodeContext: Giving in

Cyanide_98.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_98.text: Now, this is a vial of wyvern poison. It's quick and painless. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.
Cyanide_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds out vial of poisonNodeContext: Serious, pressing

Cyanide_367.speaker: Player
Cyanide_367.text: Before you and my god, I swear it.

Cyanide_180.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_180.text: I hope it doesn't come to that but... thank you. Here.

Cyanide_428.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_428.text: And here's the antidote. Do not mix those two up.
Cyanide_428.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player takes antidote from Nettie
NodeContext: Hands you the antidote. 'Don't mix them up' refers to the antidote and the poison

Cyanide_103.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_103.text: Thank you. I truly hope it doesn't come to that.

Cyanide_214.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_214.text: Here, take this. It'll stop the poison, but I can't do anything for that wriggler in your head.
Cyanide_214.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes antidote from NettieNodeContext: Nettie hands you the antidote

Cyanide_358.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_358.text: Now, I've an antidote - um... where is the bloody thing?
Cyanide_358.context: NodeContext: Starts to say 'Now, I've an antidote here for you', but realises that it's missing. Patting her pockets, trying to find it. (The player stole it without her noticing)

Cyanide_147.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_147.text: Well, not to worry. Have a read of that book - Flora of the Dalelands. There's a recipe for your antidote in there.

Cyanide_198.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_198.text: It won't cure what's in your head, though.

Cyanide_247.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_247.text: Master Halsin and I were tracking them, studying them, trying to figure out what the hells was going on.

Cyanide_288.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_288.text: Because you should all be changing - there should be a small army of mind flayers out there! But you're not. Weird powers aside, you seem perfectly normal.

Cyanide_269.speaker: Player
Cyanide_269.text: What do you mean 'should' be changing?

Cyanide_316.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_316.text: Mind flayers reproduce by infecting someone with their parasite. Seven gruesome days later, the victim transforms and a new mind flayer is born.

Cyanide_394.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_394.text: The thing in your skull, though? It's different to anything in our records.

Cyanide_29.speaker: Player
Cyanide_29.text: You must've learned something from studying them.

Cyanide_309.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_309.text: For one, that thing in your head is like nothing we've ever seen from mind flayers.

Cyanide_415.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_415.text: It's one of their worms, for sure, but this one gives you powers - telepathic connections. And it doesn't turn you into one of them.

Cyanide_76.speaker: Player
Cyanide_76.text: So you think it's only a matter of time?

Cyanide_203.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_203.text: Could be, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

Cyanide_50.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_50.text: When Master Halsin heard the adventurers were heading that way, he saw a chance to get answers. Joined on the spot.

Cyanide_138.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_138.text: Whatever he found there, he didn't make it back.

Cyanide_384.speaker: Player
Cyanide_384.text: What do you want me to do?

Cyanide_241.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_241.text: The thing is, I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. None of us can even get close.

Cyanide_289.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_289.text: I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. And if my birds can't get close, what chance do I have?

Cyanide_162.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_162.text: I think so. I hope so. I've sent birds to find him, but they can't get close without goblins trying to shoot them down.

Cyanide_146.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_146.text: You, though? You're one of them - technically speaking, I mean. They won't kill someone carrying their parasite.

Cyanide_338.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_338.text: If you can get Halsin out of there, we can discover what he learned. And perhaps he can save your life. How's that sound?

Cyanide_235.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_235.text: If you can find Halsin and get him out of there, we can discover what he learned. And perhaps he can save your life. How's that sound?

Cyanide_11.speaker: Player
Cyanide_11.text: I already know where to find him: the worg pens of the goblin camp.

Cyanide_275.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_275.text: Gods above - why didn't you say so?
Cyanide_275.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

Cyanide_18.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_18.text: Please, you have to bring him back to us. For your own sake as much as ours.

Cyanide_306.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_306.text: Thank you. It would mean everything to the grove. To me.

Cyanide_270.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_270.text: I wish I could tell you what happened out there, but those adventurers were the only witnesses. And they're long gone.

Cyanide_164.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_164.text: I wish I could tell you more, but only those adventurers know what happened out there.

Cyanide_318.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_318.text: All I can say for sure is they all went to the old temple of Selûne and Master Halsin didn't make it back.

Cyanide_99.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_99.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the oath you swore.

Cyanide_246.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_246.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the vial. Remember your oath.

Cyanide_161.speaker: Player
Cyanide_161.text: It sounds like you're making a lot of assumptions that could kill me.

Cyanide_47.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_47.text: The way I see it, you have two options. Halsin or that wyvern poison.

Cyanide_64.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_64.text: I don't envy your choice, truly. But this is the hand fate's dealt you.

Cyanide_343.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_343.text: The way I see it, you have two options. Halsin or death - whatever form it takes.

Cyanide_134.speaker: Player
Cyanide_134.text: You're sure he can cure me?

Cyanide_107.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_107.text: I can't make any promises. This is like nothing we've seen before.

Cyanide_215.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_215.text: But I know this for sure: Master Halsin is the only one close to understanding these things. He's your best bet to survive.

Cyanide_412.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_412.text: Otherwise, that vial's your only option.

Cyanide_421.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_421.text: Otherwise you'll need to end things yourself, before the transformation really takes hold.

Cyanide_158.speaker: Player
Cyanide_158.text: That sounds like suicide. I won't do it.

Cyanide_139.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_139.text: It might be suicide either way. Trust me, you do not want to become one of those monsters.

Cyanide_237.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_237.text: But of course, the choice is yours. I just hope you find a cure out there.

Cyanide_361.speaker: Player
Cyanide_361.text: You said you were tracking other victims. Did they change?

Cyanide_413.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_413.text: Hard to say, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

Cyanide_176.speaker: Player
Cyanide_176.text: Excellent news! All the power, none of the tentacles.

Cyanide_229.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_229.text: I wouldn't be so sure. There's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

Cyanide_277.speaker: Player
Cyanide_277.text: Just tell me if there's a cure or not.

Cyanide_390.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_390.text: You can't cure what you don't understand. And as much as I know about mind flayers, I can't make heads nor tails of this.

Cyanide_317.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_317.text: I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.
Cyanide_317.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

Cyanide_327.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_327.context: CinematicNodeContext: still holding out vialNodeContext: Pressing tone, still holding out vial

Cyanide_83.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_83.text: Then I'm sorry, but I can't. You're too dangerous.

Cyanide_194.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_194.text: By rights your teeth should be falling out and your skin turning grey. I don't know why you haven't changed, but I can't risk you suddenly turning into a mind flayer.

Cyanide_263.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_263.text: Do whatever you need to, but we're not leaving this room until it's over.

Cyanide_151.speaker: Player
Cyanide_151.text: Fine - but better hope it works. Poison doesn't always hurt the pure of body.

Cyanide_106.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_106.text: Fine is not enough. Look at me.

Cyanide_287.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_287.text: But first, swear to me you'll do what needs to be done.

Cyanide_210.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_210.text: Swear that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.
Cyanide_210.context: NodeContext: 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

Cyanide_56.speaker: Player
Cyanide_56.text: I won't turn into one of them.

Cyanide_100.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: not holding any vialInternalNodeContext: Normally she offers a vial, but she doesn't have it because it was previously stolen from herNodeContext: Pressing tone

Cyanide_355.speaker: Player
Cyanide_355.text: Are you mad? I'm not going to kill myself - symptoms or not.

Cyanide_133.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_133.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

Cyanide_221.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_221.text: The door's locked. Neither of us are leaving until this is done.

Cyanide_429.speaker: Player
Cyanide_429.text: You said there were others like me - we need to cure this, or your kin will never be safe.

Cyanide_92.speaker: Player
Cyanide_92.text: I'm the only one that can find Halsin.

Cyanide_108.speaker: Player
Cyanide_108.text: You said I have time - let me use it.

Cyanide_77.speaker: Player
Cyanide_77.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

Cyanide_293.speaker: Player
Cyanide_293.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

Cyanide_365.speaker: Player
Cyanide_365.text: I have important information - the grove will be destroyed without it.

Cyanide_113.speaker: Player
Cyanide_113.text: I'm safe - I'm not showing symptoms, and it's been days.

Cyanide_93.speaker: Player
Cyanide_93.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

Cyanide_234.speaker: Player
Cyanide_234.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

Cyanide_252.speaker: Player
Cyanide_252.text: Recite her order's druidic law - this can't be allowed!

Cyanide_114.speaker: Player
Cyanide_114.text: You can't do this - your leader needs to talk to me.

Cyanide_383.speaker: Player
Cyanide_383.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

Cyanide_74.speaker: Player
Cyanide_74.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!

Cyanide_405.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_405.text: You're not getting out of here. I'll do whatever I have to to protect my kin.

Cyanide_128.speaker: Player
Cyanide_128.text: I have important information - your grove will die without it.

Cyanide_230.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_230.text: We can look after our own. Starting with this.

Cyanide_430.speaker: Player
Cyanide_430.text: But I'm safe - I'm not showing symptoms, and it's been days.

Cyanide_52.speaker: Player
Cyanide_52.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

Cyanide_339.speaker: Player
Cyanide_339.text: Recite her order's druidic law - this can't be allowed!

Cyanide_251.speaker: Player
Cyanide_251.text: Recite what you know of her order - this can't be allowed!

Cyanide_408.speaker: Player
Cyanide_408.text: You can't do this - your leader needs to talk to me.

Cyanide_294.speaker: Player
Cyanide_294.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!

Cyanide_397.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_397.text: I understand you're angry, I really do, but I won't let you endanger these people.

Cyanide_389.speaker: Player
Cyanide_389.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - no druid could support this!

Cyanide_279.speaker: Player
Cyanide_279.text: You can't do this - your leader needs to talk to me.

Cyanide_15.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_15.text: I respect Kagha, but she can't order me to put everyone's lives at risk.

Cyanide_5.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_5.text: The door's locked. Neither of us are leaving until this is done.

Cyanide_370.speaker: Player
Cyanide_370.text: You're not asking. This is a threat.

Cyanide_69.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hunches down, ready to swing the thorn, clearly about to attack you.NodeContext: Frustrated, about to attack you because she's run out of other options. She hunches down, ready to swing the thorn, clearly about to attack you.

Cyanide_220.speaker: Player
Cyanide_220.text: Dodge when she lunges for you.

Cyanide_152.speaker: Narrator
Cyanide_152.text: *You dodge her blow, but as you regain your footing, you can see the pain in her eyes.*
Cyanide_152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie lunges at the player with the thorn, but the player dodges back, avoiding the cut

Cyanide_368.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_368.text: I'm sorry, I truly am, but I can't let you go.
Cyanide_368.context: NodeContext: Tried to poison you, but you dodged away. Now she's blocking your path.

Cyanide_386.speaker: Narrator
Cyanide_386.text: *You try to dodge her blow, but she catches you, scratching your hand.*
Cyanide_386.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie scratches the player as they try to dodge her

Cyanide_85.speaker: Player
Cyanide_85.text: Don't be a fool. I'd kill you before you could blink.

Cyanide_307.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_307.text: I - I'm sorry, but I can't let you go.
Cyanide_307.context: NodeContext: Scared, but determined not to let you leave

Cyanide_226.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_226.text: If you transform out there, you'll kill everyone in the grove. Everyone for leagues around.

Cyanide_101.speaker: Player
Cyanide_101.text: I know where Halsin is! I can save him, but only if you let me go.

Cyanide_364.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_364.text: If anyone can help you, it'll be him. He studied that tadpole for days, and the birds told him about plenty of others with the same infection.

Cyanide_381.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_381.text: I'll unlock the door, but I have one condition.
Cyanide_381.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie moves to her work bench

Cyanide_208.speaker: Player
Cyanide_208.text: The drow didn't transform - I won't either.

Cyanide_297.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_297.text: The drow's tadpole was dormant, not dead. It didn't transform, but that's not to say it wouldn't have.

Cyanide_254.speaker: Player
Cyanide_254.text: I'm not showing symptoms - that means I have time.

Cyanide_296.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_296.text: Master Halsin did say the drow's tadpole was dormant. Maybe yours is too.

Cyanide_261.speaker: Player
Cyanide_261.text: I just want a chance to find a cure.

Cyanide_181.speaker: Player
Cyanide_181.text: No one else can stop those goblins. You need me.

Cyanide_34.speaker: Player
Cyanide_34.text: Exactly! I'm glad you're coming to your senses.

Cyanide_40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: Nettie relents, walking over to the desk.
Match blocking to "All right! Master Halsin did say the drow's tadpole was dormant. Maybe yours is too."

Cyanide_305.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_305.text: All right, but on one condition.

Cyanide_172.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_172.text: This is a vial of wyvern poison. Swear to me you'll swallow it if you feel any symptoms.
Cyanide_172.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds out vial of poison

Cyanide_1.speaker: Player
Cyanide_1.text: More poison? I would've preferred a cure.

Cyanide_26.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_26.text: I don't have a cure. Only a way out.

Cyanide_12.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_12.text: I'm sorry for misleading you, but I had to be sure you weren't a threat before I told you everything.

Cyanide_423.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_423.text: Now, do I have your word or not?

Cyanide_276.speaker: Player
Cyanide_276.text: I thought you could cure me? What about that branch of yours?

Cyanide_136.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_136.text: The thorn? Coated in a fatal toxin. It was a last resort, in case I couldn't trust you.

Cyanide_7.speaker: Player
Cyanide_7.text: Before you and my god, I swear it.

Cyanide_2.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_2.text: You know, I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.

Cyanide_54.speaker: Player
Cyanide_54.text: No. I'm not taking poison from a woman I can't trust.

Cyanide_362.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_362.text: But you have to. Don't you understand? You could kill us all!

Cyanide_268.speaker: Player
Cyanide_268.text: I don't care - I am not going to die!

Cyanide_369.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_369.text: Then I've no choice. I'm sorry.

Cyanide_170.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_170.text: Swear to me that if you feel any symptoms, you'll end things yourself.
Cyanide_170.context: NodeContext: 'you'll end things yourself' = you'll kill yourself.

Cyanide_175.speaker: Player
Cyanide_175.text: I won't turn into one of them.

Cyanide_267.speaker: Player
Cyanide_267.text: Are you mad? I'm not going to kill myself - symptoms or not.

Cyanide_322.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_322.text: I don't want to hurt you, but I can't let you live. You're too dangerous.

Cyanide_82.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_82.context: NodeContext: Pained voice, she's going to fight and try to kill you, even though she doesn't want to

Cyanide_332.speaker: Player
Cyanide_332.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - she can't support this!

Cyanide_72.speaker: Player
Cyanide_72.text: Try to recall the tenets of her order - no druid could support this!

Cyanide_94.speaker: Player
Cyanide_94.text: You can't hit me, let alone kill me. Don't make me put you down.

Cyanide_395.speaker: Player
Cyanide_395.text: I'm trained in combat, you're a druid with a stick. Don't make me kill you.

Cyanide_61.speaker: Player
Cyanide_61.text: I don't need to transform to kill everyone. Stand down.

Cyanide_31.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_31.text: You - you're right. I'm no use to the others dead.

Cyanide_95.speaker: Narrator
Cyanide_95.text: *She doesn't hesitate, moving quickly. Before you realise what's happening, you feel a burning scratch on your hand.*
Cyanide_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie scratches the player as they try to reason with her

Cyanide_393.speaker: Player
Cyanide_393.text: Attack her first - kill her quickly.

Cyanide_200.speaker: Player
Cyanide_200.text: Cure me first, then I'll answer all the questions you want.

Cyanide_325.speaker: Player
Cyanide_325.text: Put the thorns down and I'll tell you.

Cyanide_6.speaker: Player
Cyanide_6.text: An intellect devourer spoke to me. That was a little odd.

Cyanide_255.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_255.text: It recognised you as being infected? Well now, that's something.

Cyanide_201.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_201.text: It might, but first things first. Tell me about your symptoms - have you noticed anything strange happening?

Cyanide_87.speaker: Narrator
Cyanide_87.text: *Looking closer, you realise you've seen this thorn in the wilds - it's Kelemvor's Kiss, a briar from the Dalelands. And a deadly poison.*

Cyanide_250.speaker: Player
Cyanide_250.text: Try to poison me and you'll regret it.

Cyanide_80.speaker: Player
Cyanide_80.text: This was a mistake. I should go.

Cyanide_286.speaker: Player
Cyanide_286.text: What is this? I came to you for help!

Cyanide_110.speaker: Player
Cyanide_110.text: Put the briar down and we'll talk.

Cyanide_17.speaker: Player
Cyanide_17.text: I don't trust you. I'm leaving.

Cyanide_354.speaker: Player
Cyanide_354.text: Just hurry up and cure me. I don't have time to chat.

Cyanide_137.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_137.text: First things first. Tell me, have you noticed anything unusual? Not just symptoms - any strange events?

Cyanide_340.speaker: Wyll
Cyanide_340.text: I'd like to stay, if it's all the same.

Cyanide_240.speaker: Gale
Cyanide_240.text: I'm interested in the procedure, actually. Please, go ahead.

Cyanide_89.speaker: Player
Cyanide_89.text: I'm hoping for a less grave cure.

Cyanide_124.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_124.text: I'll do the best I can.
Cyanide_124.context: NodeContext: JLatino: Holding up a long thorn that's been removed from a vine, nettie almost murmurs the line, distracted by her own thoughts

Cyanide_335.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_335.text: I'm no Master Halsin, mind. He'd have your tadpole out like that. Still, we have options.
Cyanide_335.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nettie moves between player and exitNodeContext: Previous line was murmured to yourself, the next line is very 'okay, let's get down to business.' This line should be a transition between the two.

Cyanide_342.speaker: Player
Cyanide_342.text: So you killed him and laid him out on the table?

Cyanide_23.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_23.context: NodeContext: JLatino: Holding up a long thorn that's been removed from a vine, nettie almost murmurs the line, distracted by her own thoughts

Cyanide_58.speaker: Player
Cyanide_58.text: Is everyone being captured by mind flayers these days? Didn't think it was a common experience.

Cyanide_178.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide_178.text: Rather too common as of late. At least that's what Master Halsin suspected.
Cyanide_178.context: NodeContext: JLatino: Holding up a long thorn that's been removed from a vine, nettie almost murmurs the line, distracted by her own thoughts

PAD_SeeDrow_3.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow_3.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow_2.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow_2.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow_0.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.
